channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Garden waste fly tip, 11th June
item.description:
More fly tipping at entrance to shared access pathway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmcroft Road, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Motorbikes being ridden in Hall Place North, 11th June
item.description:
Now summer has arrived we have an issue every evening starting around 5pm where motorbikes are being ridden in Hall Place North. This happened last summer and is now happening again. The air and noise pollution is not great but also as far as I am aware it is illegal to do this. I did try last year to stop it but basically they ignored me. Please get this stopped.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Coldblow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement Extruding Upward, 11th June
item.description:
The tree roots outside 9 Glengarry Road has caused extreme damage to the pavement restricting movement of the elderly, disabled, push chair users etc. It has been like this for a long time but causes people to walk into the road to avoid the pavement making it extremely dangerous for children.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Glengarry Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged virgin media cabinet with exposed cables, 11th June
item.description:
The cabinet is getting more dangerous and there are exposed cables

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wyndcliff Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Used bandages on the floor close to n.34, 11th June
item.description:
There are some used bandages on the floor on the pathway ( so public land) close to n.34 Wellington Gardens. They been there since weeks. This is a potential bio hazard issue as neighbours have spotted carers disposing of used blue gloves and sanitary material on the floor.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Gardens, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
This has been tagged with graffiti, please remove
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hanover Park, Peckham, London

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Fly tipping, 11th June
item.description:
People keep dumping iteams in these areas , right next to the fly tipping sign !!!! Sick and tired of this. This happen today between 16;17-16;42.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bideford Road, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overhangs onto my drive, 11th June
item.description:
The tree is overhanging onto my (53) and my neighbours (55) driveways which is resulting in a lot of mess dropping onto my drive & car. Most notably bird-droppings but also things like twigs and branches which hit my car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Swanbridge Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bushes etc reducing road width, 11th June
item.description:
As you can see this yearly problem in Greenfield Drive, of bushes youg trees reducing the road with, bearing in mind we have no pavements, it is hard for two larger vehicles(grocery or parcel deliveries to pass at the same time, and even with cars being larger now, it’s more like a one way entrance, can we please have them reduced in size as you have done in previous years?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenfield Drive, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Bike, 11th June
item.description:
Abandoned bike, chained to parking signpost, one wheel missing. There was a sign on it to give notice of removal, this has been removed and the bike is still there. Could someone please remove this eyesore.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing LTN bollArd, 11th June
item.description:
The bollard is still missing at the end of Road, Neville Road Junction. It has been reported several times reports seem to be ignored. What’s the problem with replacing the bollard? . There have been many report and nothing has been done.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nevill Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
